alert.note: Alert for Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 1:41AM EDT until May 03 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues for Choconut Creek. * WHERE...Portions of central New York and northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, in central New York, Broome. In northeast Pennsylvania, Susquehanna. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Vestal Center Park has flooded, and water has also reached into backyards of residences closest to the Choconut Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 135 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. While little additional rainfall is expected, responses to earlier rainfall continue. - The water level of Choconut Creek at Choconut has started falling and will continue to do so. Flood waters are expected to recede by 3 AM. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vestal and Vestal Center. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
